response.answer_text: No - not in any sense we use today. They did spend time in prayer, and they did have a number of special rituals that are described on temple walls and in many papyri, tombs, and coffins. In truth, there was little time for such things for most people; over 90% of the population were simple laborers, more concerned with their farms and their families and their crops than any esoteric practices.
